sources.title: The Dirty Dozen (1967) Lee Marvin · Ernest Borgnine
sources.description: In 1944, a deposed American major is forced to form a "suicide squad" of 12 criminal psychopaths in a military penal camp. Together they are tasked with raiding an SS barracks and, through this "probation," are released from the most severe court sentences. Only two of them survive, their limbs shot to pieces.   A perfectly staged, equally dark and brutal war thriller with impressive acting performances, the film only manages to shock viewers through its conspicuous absence of any moral and psychological depth or evaluation.

metadata.Plot: A Major with an attitude problem and a history of getting things done is told to interview military prisoners with death sentences or long terms for a dangerous mission; To parachute behind enemy lines and cause havoc for the German Generals at a rest house on the eve of D-Day.
metadata.Writer: Nunnally Johnson, Lukas Heller, E.M. Nathanson
metadata.Actors: Lee Marvin, Ernest Borgnine, Charles Bronson
